page.title: 01LANDSCAPE:BLEASBY/THURGARTON
page.content: Although no part of it appears in this{South Nottinghamshire}block the{ {River Trent}dominates it. Indeed the Trent created all that is the landscape. The melting waters of the last{Ice Age}formed such a torrent that this river ignored its proto course a few miles south in the Vale Of Belvoir,and,paying no heed to the surface geology,ripped out a trench a good mile wide. The river,tight up against its steep, valley boundary, runs just to the S.E.The valley fills all but the N.W. corner of the block. This N.E. area, reached up a fairly steep,general slope,is of lightly rolling countryside.In this block are the villages of{Bleasby}and{ {Thurgarton}and the hamlets of{Gibsmere and{Goverton.}These settlements are about half way on a straight line between{Nottigham}and{Newark.
